description: Join us for a unique opportunity to step inside the working studios of Tannery Artists. This event offers the chance to meet the artists, explore their work in progress, engage in conversation about wide range of artistic practices, and gain insight into different creative processes.
facilities: Handrails on one side of stairs

factsheet.heading: Tannery Arts
paragraphs: Tannery Arts is a Community Benefit Society that supports both emerging and established artists by providing affordable, long-term studio spaces and fostering professional development. Founded on a collaborative and equality-based ethos, the organisation is led by artist Co-Directors Andrew Bick and Fiona Long, with all staff also practising artists. Tannery Arts runs exhibitions and commissions under Tannery Projects and works in partnership with local authorities, social housing providers, and arts organisations to connect communities with contemporary art. A member of the Artists Affordable Studios Network, Tannery has been active since 2000.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Built in 1905, Winchester House is a remarkable part of London’s architectural and cultural heritage. Originally serving as the headquarters for London’s expanding fleet of black cabs, the building once accommodated offices and facilities for up to 2,000 taxis.
Later, it became home to the University of Wales, traces of which still linger in the preserved interior signage.
Today, Winchester House is revitalised as a creative hub, with its grand indoor spaces transformed into studios by Tannery Arts, continuing its legacy through art and innovation.

travel_info: Additional travel info: located in South East part of the Kennington Business Park Centre - entrance through the gate by Cranmer Road (close to Brixton Rd junction)

name: Tannery Arts: Winchester House Studios
